result.execSummary:
This case has not been concluded. Unless a judgment of conviction is entered, the defendant is presumed innocent of all charges.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

result.caption: State of Wisconsin vs. Kenneth Dwayne Evans

defendant.name: Evans, Kenneth Dwayne
defendant.address: 2327 W Michigan Street Apt 303, Milwaukee, WI 53233

records.addlTxt: Received and Filed: Attorney Megan Kaldunski

Defendant Kenneth Dwayne Evans appeared by video.  Attorney Theodore D. Kafkas appeared by video for Kenneth Dwayne Evans.  Prosecuting attorney Arthur Kenneth Thexton in court for the State of Wisconsin. 
Motions by the defense are heard and denied by the Court. Preliminary hearing proceeded.  Sworn for the State: MPD Detective E. Steele. State rests.  Defense rests.  Defense motion to dismiss argued and denied. Court found probable cause and bound defendant over for trial.  Original information received and filed. Matter is set for arraignment. Case is adjourned to Branch 02.
Arraignment scheduled for November 22, 2022 at 08:30 am.
Received and Filed: Pretrial Services Supervision Report - 10-03-2022

Defendant Kenneth Dwayne Evans in court.  Attorney Theodore D. Kafkas in court for Kenneth Dwayne Evans.  Attorney James C Griffin in court for State of Wisconsin. 

Case in court for a status conference.  Preliminary court previously set the matter over for a State v. Lee hearing.  Attorney Theodore Kafkas appointed.  Court scheduled the matter for a preliminary hearing.  Case adjourned to Branch PE, Rm 146 CJF.
Preliminary hearing scheduled for October 3, 2022 at 08:30 am.
Received and Filed: Pretrial Services Supervision Report - 09-23-2022

Defendant Kenneth Dwayne Evans not in court, in custody.  Attorney James C Griffin in court for State of Wisconsin. 

Case in court for a State v. Lee hearing.  State Public Defender's Office notified clerk by email that case will be assigned to Attorney Theodore Kafkas. Court scheduled a status conference.  Attorney Kafkas notified of next court date.  Case adjourned to Branch 2, Rm 635 CH.
Status conference scheduled for September 23, 2022 at 08:30 am.
Received and Filed: OSPD Appointment of Counsel Report
Received and Filed: OSPD Appointment of Counsel Report

Defendant Kenneth Dwayne Evans not in court, in custody.  Abby Rockendorf in court appeared in person for the State of Wisconsin. 
Case set for a preliminary hearing. State witness present. SPD has not appointed counsel. Due to the PRO SE motion, Court ordered case adjourned for CAUSE for a STATE V-LEE Hearing in the trial court. Date provided by Br. 02 Clerk.
Hearing scheduled for September 2, 2022 at 11:00 am.
Defendant's Motion to Dismiss.  (Kenneth D. Evans, Jr. - 5D/6, Milwaukee County Jail, 949 N 9th St, Milwaukee WI 53233).

Defendant Kenneth Dwayne Evans not in court, defendant in custody.  Abby Rockendorf appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  
Case set for a preliminary hearing. States witness is present. SPD has not appointed counsel. Court ordered case adjourned for CAUSE for a Preliminary Hearing in Preliminary Hearing Court, Room 146 of the Criminal Justice Facility.  Preliminary hearing scheduled for August 24, 2022 at 01:30 pm.
Signed and filed, No Contact Order.  Defendant to have no contact with DJB, LW

Court ordered defendant TURNED OVER TO Justice Point for Level 5 Supervision with Electronic Monitoring; no contact order.  If an Electronic Monitoring Device (GPS) is unavailable and Cash Bail has been paid, Defendant to be released and placed on the Electronic Monitoring (GPS) waiting list.  No possession of dangerous weapons or firearms.

Defendant Kenneth Dwayne Evans in court with attorney Robert W Peterson.  Defendant Kenneth Dwayne Evans in custody.  Kimberly Dorice Schoepp appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Kenneth Dwayne Evans appeared by video means with Attorney.  Defendant is advised this case is assigned to Judge Childs, Branch 02.  AS TO COUNTS 1 & 2 ENHANCERS:  Defense motions to dismiss.  Defense argument heard.  State moves to reserve argument for trial court.  Court reserves argument for trial court.   Defendant given a copy of the complaint and advised of maximum penalties, right to counsel and right to a preliminary hearing.  Court reviewed the complaint and found probable cause to hold defendant for further proceedings.  Defense enters a plea of NOT GUILTY as to misdemeanor count 1.  DEFENDANT IS INDIGENT AND PUBLIC DEFENDER WILL PROVIDE COUNSEL.  Commissioner advised DNA sample has been obtained from the Defendant.  Court advised Defendant he may qualify to have the DNA sample data expunged if he meets the conditions under Wisconsin Statutes Section 165.77(4).  Preliminary hearing scheduled for July 28, 2022 at 08:30 am.
Defendant in Custody, Court appearance today in Intake Court, Room 137A.

Arrest Warrant received from the D.A.'s office on filing date of Criminal Complaint.
